hedline.hl1: Times and Holtzbrinck Group Agree to Revive Times Books

abstract.p: The New York Times and Holtzbrinck Publishers, US arm of German von Holtzbrinck Group, will revive Times Books imprint and also expand Times book development; Henry Holt unit of Holtzbrinck will publish titles; imprint has been dormant since licensing agreement with Random House expired in 1999 (S)

block.p: The New York Times and Holtzbrinck Publishers, the United States arm of the German media company von Holtzbrinck Group, agreed yesterday to restart the Times Books imprint and expand The Times's book development.

Henry Holt & Company, a United States unit of Holtzbrinck, will publish in cooperation with The Times a list of books under the Times Books imprint, beginning next year with about 14 titles. The Times Books imprint will eventually publish 20 nonfiction books a year about current events, history, science, technology, business, health and other subjects. Some of the first books will be based on coverage in The New York Times, including ''How Race Is Lived in America,'' ''Writers on Writing,'' ''The New York Times Management Reader'' and ''The New York Times Guide to Alternative Medicine.''

The New York Times and Holtzbrinck Publishers, the United States arm of the German media company von Holtzbrinck Group, agreed yesterday to restart the Times Books imprint and expand The Times's book development.

Henry Holt & Company, a United States unit of Holtzbrinck, will publish in cooperation with The Times a list of books under the Times Books imprint, beginning next year with about 14 titles. The Times Books imprint will eventually publish 20 nonfiction books a year about current events, history, science, technology, business, health and other subjects. Some of the first books will be based on coverage in The New York Times, including ''How Race Is Lived in America,'' ''Writers on Writing,'' ''The New York Times Management Reader'' and ''The New York Times Guide to Alternative Medicine.''

St. Martin's Press, another unit of Holtzbrinck in the United States, will publish other books bearing the New York Times brand, like The Times's crossword puzzle books. St. Martin's will also distribute other books published by The New York Times. The Times has previously published hotel, restaurant and museum guides as well as yearbooks about the Yankees and a photographic history of Times Square.

The Times Company, a diversified media company that also owns The Boston Globe, began publishing books in 1969, when it acquired Quadrangle Books, based in Chicago. In 1977, the company changed its imprint to Times Books. From 1984 through 1999, the Times licensed the imprint to Random House. The imprint ceased publication when the license agreement expired in December 1999.
